country.name: Italy
country.overview: Italy, a European country with a long Mediterranean coastline, has left a powerful mark on Western culture and cuisine. Its capital, Rome, is home to the Vatican as well as landmark art and ancient ruins. Other major cities include Florence, with Renaissance masterpieces such as Michelangelo’s \"David\" and Brunelleschi's Duomo; Venice, the city of canals; and Milan, Italy’s fashion capital.

translations.name: ປະເທດອິຕາລີ
အီတလီနိုင်ငံ
ประเทศอิตาลี

geography.location_description: Southern Europe, a peninsula extending into the central Mediterranean Sea, northeast of Tunisia
geography.area_note: almost twice the size of Georgia; slightly larger than Arizona
geography.climate: predominantly Mediterranean; alpine in far north; hot, dry in south
geography.terrain: mostly rugged and mountainous; some plains, coastal lowlands
geography.hazards: regional risks include landslides, mudflows, avalanches, earthquakes, volcanic eruptions, flooding; land subsidence in Venice
geography.notes: strategic location dominating central Mediterranean as well as southern sea and air approaches to Western Europe
